name: Bee Garden
review:
The space is huge — it has two floors, and a third one was under renovation when I visited. There’s also a spacious terrace.
What I loved most was the menu: they focus on healthier options and use homemade products like butter, jam, and granola. You’ll find breakfast and brunch menus, as well as lunch dishes like bagels, toasts, and burgers.
A personal highlight: two little tables by the window. I sat there working while watching the rain outside — the perfect cozy spot. They’re very laptop-friendly — in fact, they mentioned the second floor is often seen as their co-working area.

name: Pátio Bonjardim
review:
"It feels like a hidden gem — literally.\n\
To enter, you pass through a shop filled with knobs and home furniture — lots of charming pieces.\n\
At the back, you’ll find a café with a big, lovely garden where birds sing and you almost forget you’re in the city center.\n\
Just note it gets quite full during lunchtime."

name: Yanetta
review: This Ukrainian café offers a brunch-focused menu, many sandwiches, cakes, and some traditional Ukrainian sweets and dishes. There's a small terrace out front with three tables, perfect for a sunny day. The interior is not very big either but it is cozy and there are two window tables which are always my go-to spot when I’m alone.
